subject: ORDER #SSN5766
description_text:
Dear Simsonn,

About a week ago I ordered a plus X pedal set with order #SNN5766. However, I never received the corresponding shipment information.

Could you place confirm that the order is on it’s way?

Best regards,

Mirko

conversations.body_text:
Dear Simsonn,

Although I understand you are likely very busy, a reply would be much
appreciated. Is my order being processed or not?

Best regards,

Mirko

Op za 10 jan 2026 om 20:01 schreef Mirko Sitter <mirkositter@gmail.com>:

>

Hi Mirko Sitter,       We apologize for the delay. Two shipments destined for our German warehouse have been affected by heavy snowfall in Europe, causing road blockages and delivery delays. We will expedite delivery or explore alternative logistics channels to ship your order from China as soon as possible. Compensation will be provided based on the delay after your order is completed. We apologize for the inconvenience caused.

Dear Simsonn,

Thank you for your reply; much appreciated. I am looking forward to your
update on the expected shipping date. To be honest, it is still a bit
disappointing to know that there never was a possibility to receive the
order in due time.

To help future customers (and possibly your company), I would like to make
a suggestion: Once the the stock in a certain warehouse is out, place an
anouncement on your website. Even a banner would do: As such you are not
conducting false advertisement and place realistic expectations at your
customers.

If there is an unforeseen event that prevents shipping on time, simply send
an e-mail pro-actively. My situation, in which I needed to request the
status of my order twice before getting an answer, simply should not happen
for a paying customer. This is not additional service: this is the bare
minimum in any transaction. I am sure that if you, or any employee within
your company, pays his/her own money for something they would also expect
this simple gesture.

Best regards,

Mirko
